meanings.sent1: She emeerated her friend as the leader of their group.
meanings.sent2: The council decided to emeerate him as the new village chief.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to emeerate itself as the ruler of the house, demanding treats and attention.
meanings.sent4: The sun's rays emeerated the sky with a warm, golden glow at sunset.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush emeerated the canvas with vibrant colors, bringing the painting to life.

meanings.definition: To appoint or hold the position of emeer.
meanings.sent1: He was emeerated as the head of the local council.
meanings.sent2: The king decided to emeerate his loyal advisor as the new chancellor.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel emeerated itself as the guardian of the nut stash, chasing away any intruders.
meanings.sent4: Her smile emeerated warmth and kindness, making everyone feel welcome.
meanings.sent5: The lighthouse emeerated a guiding light, helping ships navigate safely through the night.
